<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ll let Mitch Hedberg take it from here: “People on the 14th floor, you know what floor you're really on.” </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORKFORCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/national-labor-relations-board-encouraging-political-talk-google?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google Employees Express Themselves
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google Employees Express Themselves" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY4MzIyMjYxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We can only assume this is a prank intended to start food fights nationwide: The National Labor Relations Board is encouraging political talk at work. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/12/technology/google-settlement-nlrb.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> Google to affirm employees’ rights to express their views on political and workplace issues. The demand aims to settle a complaint made to the regulator about Google allegedly clamping down on speech. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The order is a reality check for Google...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...which likes to think of itself as a haven for dissenting opinion. But recently, current and former Googlers have accused the company of overreaching in its restrictions on what employees can discuss. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Both sides of the aisle can unite against management.</strong> Some conservatives at the company have said their views <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/government-orders-google-let-employees-speak-out-11568284582?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make them pariahs</a> on Google’s campus. Some liberals say their opposition to YouTube’s changing policy on hate speech has fallen on deaf ears. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One former engineer, Kevin Cernekee, claims he was fired for expressing right-wing beliefs on company message boards. Google says he was fired for violating company policies, including downloading confidential documents onto a personal device. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Not mad, just disappointed</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>As part of the settlement, Google will announce to employees that it’s scrapping a proposed set of rules restricting what they can say to each other and the media. </span>A spokesperson for the company said it will also post a notice reminding employees of their rights. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Between the lines:</strong></span><span> The board is </span><span><em>not</em></span><span> making a formal determination about whether Google behaved inappropriately. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Google’s press release writers are getting a workout </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They probably know the word “settlement” in every language. Just yesterday, the company <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-tech-google-tax/google-agrees-to-550-million-fine-in-france-to-settle-fiscal-fraud-probe-idUSKCN1VX1SM?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to settle a tax fraud investigation with French authorities for over $1 billion. And last week, Google-owned YouTube <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/4/20848949/google-ftc-youtube-child-privacy-violations-fine-170-milliion-coppa-ads?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was fined</a> $170 million to resolve a probe into the video platform’s ad targeting practices for children’s content.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Google hasn’t lived up to its dissent-friendly reputation.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F12%2Fnational-labor-relations-board-encouraging-political-talk-google" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=We+can+only+assume+this+is+a+prank+intended+to+start+food+fights+nationwide&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/national-labor-relations-board-encouraging-political-talk-google&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/draghi-tries-juice-european-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Draghi Tries to Juice the European Economy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Draghi Tries to Juice the European Economy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY4MzIxOTc3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>c-yung/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, the European Central Bank announced its largest set of <a href="https://apnews.com/abb7a9ab834b4e358df8f9a4232ae9f8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stimulus measures</a> in three years, including: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dropping the interest rate on deposits from -0.4% to -0.5%</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A pledge to maintain low rates until inflation crawls back up near 2%</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Restarting monthly bond purchases of 20 billion euros</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Concerns: </strong>Some analysts worry the ECB will take so many trips to the bond store that the shelves will <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ecb-launches-major-stimulus-package-cuts-key-rate-11568289016?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">run dry</a> in about a year. Plus, with ECB President Mario Draghi unleashing all the big guns to boost the economy, there could be little ammo left if a big downturn occurs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Draghi’s asking European governments, <em>especially</em> Germany, to rely a little less on central bank action and spend more. But...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...don’t hold your breath waiting on Europe’s largest economy to start spending on big projects like infrastructure, even if you say “bitte.” As <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/11/economy/germany-economy-recession-stimulus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNN notes</a>, German leaders have historically been wary of borrowing. Besides, Oktoberfest is about to start and they have priorities.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Back in the U.S.</strong>, President Trump <a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1172120964232093697?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized</a> Draghi’s plan as an attempt to hurt U.S. exports, then resumed jabbing his favorite Fed punching bag with requests for rate cuts next week.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/jj-abrams-sings-monster-deal-warnermedia?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
J.J. Abrams Finds His Island
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTMyLzEyMDBweC1zdGFyX3RyZWtfYmV5b25kX2phcGFuX3ByZW1pZXJlX3JlZF9jYXJwZXQtX2pfal9hYnJhbXNfMjgzMTM0NzU4NjY0M18yOV9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dick Thomas Johnson from Tokyo, Japan, Star Trek Beyond Japan Premiere Red Carpet- J. J. Abrams (31347586643), CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, J.J. Abrams and Katie McGrath’s production company, Bad Robot, <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/jj-abrams-officially-closes-sizable-warnermedia-film-tv-partnership-1232979?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> a five-year deal with AT&T’s WarnerMedia. Terms weren’t disclosed, but THR’s sources put it around $250 million. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The prolific producer’s TV business has been under the Warner Bros. umbrella since 2006. But under the new deal, Bad Robot’s film work will join the family, as well as games and digital content. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The deal runs through 2024.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Media and tech companies are competing to take household-name creators to the streaming prom...and they’re spending all their allowance. Netflix recently <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/game-thrones-creators-close-200m-netflix-deal-1230119?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inked</a> eye-popping deals with Ryan Murphy of <em>Glee</em> ($300 million) and duo D.B. Weiss and David Benioff of <em>It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia</em> fame ($200 million). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple </span><span><a href="https://deadline.com/2019/09/jj-abrams-warnermedia-megadeal-film-television-1202732674/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">came close</a></span><span> to picking up Abrams in its limo. Comcast/NBCUniversal and Sony also tried but got turned down. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what made Abrams go with WarnerMedia?</strong> Reportedly, the right to work with other studios and WarnerMedia CEO John Stankey’s tireless efforts to bring Bad Robot on board.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/epas-rollback?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The EPA's on a Rollback
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Environmental Protection Agency repealed a major Obama-era environmental protection for streams and wetlands. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Before 2015, the EPA <a href="https://www.politico.com/story/2019/09/12/trump-repeal-epa-water-rule-1492183?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decided case-by-case</a> whether individual streams or wetlands had significant impacts on downstream rivers and were therefore subject to federal clean water standards.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In 2015</strong></span><span>, the Obama administration </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/12/climate/trump-administration-rolls-back-clean-water-protections.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">created</a></span><span> federal pollution protections for ~60% of U.S. waters, including these smaller waterways. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, the EPA wants to go back to the old system. The repeal was Step 1: Next, it’ll create stricter requirements for what waterways can be federally protected. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Water they doing this for</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Trump administration says the 2015 rule stepped on states’ toes, was too broadly written, and made life unreasonably difficult for businesses.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To give you a clue who didn’t like it...the repeal was signed at the National Association of Manufacturers’s HQ. Farmers, miners, developers, and oil and gas companies also weren’t fans.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is the Trump administration’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/climate/trump-environment-rollbacks.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">7th trim</a> of water pollution regulations. To date, it’s completed or is working on rollbacks of 84 other environmental rules.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/brews-weekly-news-quiz-september-13?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Quizkaidekaphobia
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Never walks under a ladder. Always keeps an open umbrella <em>outside</em>. Fingers are forever crossed. It's the Brew's Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. At its event on Tuesday, Apple revealed the prices for its TV and gaming subscription services. Which costs more in the U.S...Apple Arcade or Apple TV+? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Which major oil-producing country appointed a new energy minister on Tuesday? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. I bought DirecTV in 2015. My CEO is Randall Stephenson. Elliott Management just revealed it owned $3.2 billion of my stock and is pushing for changes. What company am I? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank: </strong>Amazon said it has _______ open positions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. This guy retired as chairman of Alibaba this week. What’s his name? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1568309294.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>VCG/VCG via Getty Images</em></sup><br><br><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1. Trick question, they cost the same at $4.99/month 2. Saudi Arabia 3. AT&T 4. 30,000 5. Jack Ma</em></sup></p>

COMMUNITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/brew-readers-little-stitious?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew Readers Are a Little Stitious
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Brew Readers Are a Little Stitious" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1ODA0MjgxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Boo</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In yesterday’s edition, we told you about our plans to pregame Friday the 13th by hearing about our readers’ superstitions. We’re very pleased with the results, probably because we tapped the doorway three times when we left our apartments this morning. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A few of your, er, not-so-scientific beliefs… </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“You must always ALWAYS eat the whole fortune cookie and take a drink before looking at your fortune. Looking at the fortune prior to eating the entire cookie will be disastrous.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Tap my forehead before I pee.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I always set my alarms and timers at odd numbers (ex. alarms—5:51am or 6:47am / microwave timer—1:33 or 2:05) but then I only listen to my car stereo set to even numbers (volume 12, 16, etc).”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Not drinking coffee if handed to me from someone's dominant hand.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Same lucky dress shirt for every final-round interview.” (How many interviews have you had? Seems like it’s not working.)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“This Friday the 13th is also a full moon...I ain’t leaving my house.”</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For those of you who went to work, stay safe. </p>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe can only assume this is a prank intended to start food fights nationwide: The National Labor Relations Board is encouraging political talk at work. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/12/technology/google-settlement-nlrb.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered\u003c/a\u003e Google to affirm employees’ rights to express their views on political and workplace issues. The demand aims to settle a complaint made to the regulator about Google allegedly clamping down on speech. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe order is a reality check for Google...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...which likes to think of itself as a haven for dissenting opinion. But recently, current and former Googlers have accused the company of overreaching in its restrictions on what employees can discuss. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBoth sides of the aisle can unite against management.\u003c/strong\u003e Some conservatives at the company have said their views \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/government-orders-google-let-employees-speak-out-11568284582?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emake them pariahs\u003c/a\u003e on Google’s campus. Some liberals say their opposition to YouTube’s changing policy on hate speech has fallen on deaf ears. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne former engineer, Kevin Cernekee, claims he was fired for expressing right-wing beliefs on company message boards. Google says he was fired for violating company policies, including downloading confidential documents onto a personal device. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNot mad, just disappointed\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs part of the settlement, Google will announce to employees that it’s scrapping a proposed set of rules restricting what they can say to each other and the media. \u003c/span\u003eA spokesperson for the company said it will also post a notice reminding employees of their rights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBetween the lines:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The board is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e making a formal determination about whether Google behaved inappropriately. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGoogle’s press release writers are getting a workout \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey probably know the word “settlement” in every language. Just yesterday, the company \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-tech-google-tax/google-agrees-to-550-million-fine-in-france-to-settle-fiscal-fraud-probe-idUSKCN1VX1SM?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced plans\u003c/a\u003e to settle a tax fraud investigation with French authorities for over $1 billion. And last week, Google-owned YouTube \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/4/20848949/google-ftc-youtube-child-privacy-violations-fine-170-milliion-coppa-ads?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas fined\u003c/a\u003e $170 million to resolve a probe into the video platform’s ad targeting practices for children’s content.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle hasn’t lived up to its dissent-friendly reputation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" store that the shelves will \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ecb-launches-major-stimulus-package-cuts-key-rate-11568289016?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erun dry\u003c/a\u003e in about a year. Plus, with ECB President Mario Draghi unleashing all the big guns to boost the economy, there could be little ammo left if a big downturn occurs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDraghi’s asking European governments, \u003cem\u003eespecially\u003c/em\u003e Germany, to rely a little less on central bank action and spend more. But...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...don’t hold your breath waiting on Europe’s largest economy to start spending on big projects like infrastructure, even if you say “bitte.” As \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/11/economy/germany-economy-recession-stimulus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCNN notes\u003c/a\u003e, German leaders have historically been wary of borrowing. Besides, Oktoberfest is about to start and they have priorities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBack in the U.S.\u003c/strong\u003e, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1172120964232093697?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticized\u003c/a\u003e Draghi’s plan as an attempt to hurt U.S. exports, then resumed jabbing his favorite Fed punching bag with requests for rate cuts next week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F12%2Fdraghi-tries-juice-european-economy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Abrams and Katie McGrath’s production company, Bad Robot, \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/jj-abrams-officially-closes-sizable-warnermedia-film-tv-partnership-1232979?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed\u003c/a\u003e a five-year deal with AT\u0026T’s WarnerMedia. Terms weren’t disclosed, but THR’s sources put it around $250 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe prolific producer’s TV business has been under the Warner Bros. umbrella since 2006. But under the new deal, Bad Robot’s film work will join the family, as well as games and digital content. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe deal runs through 2024.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMedia and tech companies are competing to take household-name creators to the streaming prom...and they’re spending all their allowance. Netflix recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/game-thrones-creators-close-200m-netflix-deal-1230119?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einked\u003c/a\u003e eye-popping deals with Ryan Murphy of \u003cem\u003eGlee\u003c/em\u003e ($300 million) and duo D.B. Weiss and David Benioff of \u003cem\u003eIt's Always Sunny in Philadelphia\u003c/em\u003e fame ($200 million). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2019/09/jj-abrams-warnermedia-megadeal-film-television-1202732674/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecame close\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to picking up Abrams in its limo. Comcast/NBCUniversal and Sony also tried but got turned down. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Environmental Protection Agency repealed a major Obama-era environmental protection for streams and wetlands. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eBefore 2015, the EPA \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/story/2019/09/12/trump-repeal-epa-water-rule-1492183?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecided case-by-case\u003c/a\u003e whether individual streams or wetlands had significant impacts on downstream rivers and were therefore subject to federal clean water standards.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn 2015\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the Obama administration \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/12/climate/trump-administration-rolls-back-clean-water-protections.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e federal pollution protections for ~60% of U.S. waters, including these smaller waterways. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, the EPA wants to go back to the old system. The repeal was Step 1: Next, it’ll create stricter requirements for what waterways can be federally protected. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWater they doing this for\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Trump administration says the 2015 rule stepped on states’ toes, was too broadly written, and made life unreasonably difficult for businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo give you a clue who didn’t like it...the repeal was signed at the National Association of Manufacturers’s HQ. Farmers, miners, developers, and oil and gas companies also weren’t fans.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is the Trump administration’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/climate/trump-environment-rollbacks.html?action=click\u0026module=RelatedLinks\u0026pgtype=Article\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e7th trim\u003c/a\u003e of water pollution regulations. To date, it’s completed or is working on rollbacks of 84 other environmental rules.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn yesterday’s edition, we told you about our plans to pregame Friday the 13th by hearing about our readers’ superstitions. We’re very pleased with the results, probably because we tapped the doorway three times when we left our apartments this morning. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA few of your, er, not-so-scientific beliefs… \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“You must always ALWAYS eat the whole fortune cookie and take a drink before looking at your fortune. Looking at the fortune prior to eating the entire cookie will be disastrous.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Tap my forehead before I pee.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I always set my alarms and timers at odd numbers (ex. alarms—5:51am or 6:47am / microwave timer—1:33 or 2:05) but then I only listen to my car stereo set to even numbers (volume 12, 16, etc).”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Not drinking coffee if handed to me from someone's dominant hand.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Same lucky dress shirt for every final-round interview.” (How many interviews have you had? Seems like it’s not working.)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“This Friday the 13th is also a full moon...I ain’t leaving my house.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor those of you who went to work, stay
